001package imagingbook.pub.corners.subpixel;
002
003import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
004
005import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
006
007/**
008 * The common interface for all sub-pixel locators in this package.
009 * @see Quadratic1
010 * @see Quadratic2
011 * @see Quartic
012 * @author WB
013 * @version 2020/10/03
014 */
015public interface MaxLocator_OLD {
016        
017        /**
018         * Tries to locate the sub-pixel maximum from the 9 discrete sample values
019         * (s0,...,s8) taken from a 3x3 neigborhood, arranged in the following order:
020         * <pre>
021         * s4 s3 s2
022         * s5 s0 s1
023         * s6 s7 s8
024         * </pre>
025         * The center value (s0) is assumed to be at position (0,0).
026         * @param s a vector containing 9 sample values in the order described above
027         * @return a 3-element array [x,y,z], with the estimated maximum position (x,y) and the associated max. value (z). 
028         * The position is relative to the center coordinate (0,0).
029         * {@code null} is returned if the maximum position could not be located.
030         */
031        public float[] getInterpolatedMax(float[] s);
032        
033        /**
034         * Enumeration of keys for {@link MaxLocator_OLD} methods.
035         */
036        public enum Method {
037                None(null),
038                Quadratic1(Quadratic1.class),
039                Quadratic2(Quadratic2.class),
040                Quartic(Quartic.class);
041
042                private Class<? extends MaxLocator_OLD> clazz;
043
044                // constructor:
045                Method(Class<? extends MaxLocator_OLD> clazz) {
046                        this.clazz = clazz;
047                }
048        }
049        
050        /**
051         * Creates a specific {@link MaxLocator_OLD} instance based on the supplied
052         * {@link Method} key.
053         * @param m the method
054         * @return a new {@link MaxLocator_OLD} instance
055         */
056        public static MaxLocator_OLD getInstance(Method m) {
057                if (m == null || m.clazz == null) {
058                        return null;
059                }
060                MaxLocator_OLD ml = null;
061                try {
062                        ml = m.clazz.newInstance();
063                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException e) { }
064                return ml;
065        }
066        
067        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
068        
069        
070        
071        
072        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
073        
074        /**
075         * 2D interpolator based on fitting a quadratic polynomial (axis-parallel
076         * paraboloid, with no mixed terms) of the form
077         * <br>
078         * f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 
079         * <br>
080         * to the supplied samples.
081         * Only 5 of the 9 supplied sample values are used (the 4 corner samples are ignored).
082         * @see MaxLocator_OLD#getInterpolatedMax(float[])
083         */
084        public static class Quadratic1 implements MaxLocator_OLD {
085                
086                private final double[] c = new double[5];       // polynomial coefficients
087                
088                public float[] getInterpolatedMax(float[] s) {
089                        c[0] = s[0];
090                        c[1] = (s[1] - s[5]) / 2;
091                        c[2] = (s[7] - s[3]) / 2;
092                        c[3] = (s[1] - 2 * s[0] + s[5]) / 2;
093                        c[4] = (s[3] - 2 * s[0] + s[7]) / 2;
094                        
095                        if (isZero(c[3]) || isZero(c[4])) {
096                                return null;
097                        }
098                        
099                        float x = (float) (-0.5 * c[1] / c[3]);
100                        float y = (float) (-0.5 * c[2] / c[4]);
101                        float z = (float) (c[0] + c[1] * x + c[2] * y + c[3] * x * x + c[4] * y * y);
102                        return new float[] {x, y, z};
103                }
104        }
105        
106        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
107        
108        /**
109         * 2D interpolator based on fitting a quadratic polynomial (non-axis-parallel 
110         * paraboloid, including mixed terms) of the form
111         * <br>
112         * f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2  + c_5 xy
113         * <br>
114         * to the supplied samples. All 9 sample values are used.
115         * @see MaxLocator_OLD#getInterpolatedMax(float[])
116         */
117        public static class Quadratic2 implements MaxLocator_OLD {
118                
119                private final double[] c = new double[6];       // polynomial coefficients
120
121                @Override
122                public float[] getInterpolatedMax(float[] s) {
123                        c[0] = s[0];
124                        c[1] = (s[1] - s[5]) / 2;
125                        c[2] = (s[7] - s[3]) / 2;
126                        c[3] = (s[1] - 2*s[0] + s[5]) / 2;
127                        c[4] = (s[3] - 2*s[0] + s[7]) / 2;
128                        c[5] = (s[4] + s[8] - s[2] - s[6]) / 4;
129                        
130                        double d = (4*c[3]*c[4] - c[5]*c[5]);
131                        if (isZero(d)) {
132                                return null;
133                        }
134                        
135                        // get max position:
136                        double a = 1.0 / d;
137                        float x = (float) (a*(c[2]*c[5] - 2*c[1]*c[4]));
138                        float y = (float) (a*(c[1]*c[5] - 2*c[2]*c[3]));
139                        // get max value:
140                        float z = (float) (c[0] + c[1]*x + c[2]*y + c[3]*x*x + c[4]*y*y + c[5]*x*y);
141                        return new float[] {x, y, z};
142                }
143        }
144        
145        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
146        
147        /**
148         * 2D interpolator based on fitting a 'quartic' (i.e., 4th-order) polynomial  of the form
149         * <br>
150         * f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 x y + c_6 x^2 y + c_7 x y^2 + c_8 x^2 y^2  
151         * <br>
152         * to the supplied samples. The underlying interpolation function passes through
153         * all sample values. The local maximum cannot be found in closed form but 
154         * is found iteratively, which is not guaranteed to succeed.
155         * All 9 sample values are used.
156         * @see MaxLocator_OLD#getInterpolatedMax(float[])
157         */
158        public static class Quartic implements MaxLocator_OLD {
159                static int DefaultMaxIterations = 20;           // iteration limit
160                static double DefaulMinMove = 1e-6;                     // smallest x/y move to continue search 
161                static double DefaultSearchWindow = 0.6;        // x/y search boundary (-xyLimit, +xyLimit)
162                
163                private final int maxIterations;
164                private final double minMove;
165                private final double searchWindow;
166                
167                private final double[] c = new double[9];       // polynomial coefficients
168                
169                // -----------------------------------------------------------
170                
171                public Quartic() {
172                        this(DefaultMaxIterations, DefaulMinMove, DefaultSearchWindow);
173                }
174                                
175                public Quartic(int maxIterations, double minMove, double searchWindow) {
176                        this.maxIterations = maxIterations;
177                        this.minMove = minMove;
178                        this.searchWindow = searchWindow;
179                }
180                
181                @Override
182                public float[] getInterpolatedMax(float[] s) {
183                        c[0] = s[0];
184                        c[1] = (s[1] - s[5]) / 2;
185                        c[2] = (s[7] - s[3]) / 2;
186                        c[3] = (s[1] - 2 * s[0] + s[5]) / 2;
187                        c[4] = (s[3] - 2 * s[0] + s[7]) / 2;
188                        c[5] = (s[4] + s[8] - s[2] - s[6]) / 4;
189                        c[6] = (s[6] + s[8] - s[2] - s[4]) / 4 - c[2];
190                        c[7] = (s[2] + s[8] - s[4] - s[6]) / 4 - c[1];
191                        c[8] = s[0] - (s[1] + s[3] + s[5] + s[7]) / 2 + (s[2] + s[4] + s[6] + s[8]) / 4;
192                        
193                        double[] xyMax = getMaxPosition();
194                        if (xyMax == null) {    // did not converge!
195                                return null;
196                        }
197                        float z = getInterpolatedValue(xyMax);
198                        return new float[] {(float) xyMax[0], (float) xyMax[1], z};
199                }
200                
201                private float getInterpolatedValue(double[] xy) {
202                        final double x = xy[0];
203                        final double y = xy[1];
204                        return (float) (c[0] + c[1]*x + c[2]*y + c[3]*x*x + c[4]*y*y
205                                                        + c[5]*x*y + c[6]*x*x*y + c[7]*x*y*y + c[8]*x*x*y*y);
206                }
207                
208                private boolean closeEnough(double a, double b) {
209                        return Math.abs(a - b) < minMove;
210                }
211                
212                private double[] getMaxPosition() {
213                        double[] Xcur = {0, 0};
214                        boolean inside = true;
215                        int n;
216                        for (n = 1; n <= maxIterations; n++) {
217                                
218                                if (Xcur[0] < -searchWindow || Xcur[0] > searchWindow || Xcur[1] < -searchWindow || Xcur[1] > searchWindow) {
219                                        inside = false;
220                                        break;
221                                }
222                                
223                                double[] Xnext = this.getNextMaxPosition(Xcur);
224                                if (closeEnough(Xcur[0], Xnext[0]) && closeEnough(Xcur[1], Xnext[1])) {
225                                        break;
226                                }
227                                
228                                Xcur[0] = Xnext[0];
229                                Xcur[1] = Xnext[1];
230                        }
231                        
232                        if (n >= maxIterations) {
233                                return null;
234//                              throw new RuntimeException("getMaxPosition() did not converge, s = \n" + toString(s));
235                        }
236                        if (!inside) {
237                                return null;
238//                              throw new RuntimeException("getMaxPosition() exceeded search limit!");
239                        }
240                        return Xcur;
241                }
242                
243                /**
244                 * Estimate max. position using Taylor expansion from the given position
245                 * @param X Taylor expansion point
246                 * @return the estimated maximum position
247                 */
248                private double[] getNextMaxPosition(double[] X) {
249                        double[] g = this.getGradient(X);
250                        double[][] Hi = this.getInverseHessian(X);
251                        return Matrix.add(X, Matrix.multiply(Matrix.multiply(-1, Hi), g));
252                }
253                
254                private double[] getGradient(double[] xy) {
255                        return this.getGradient(xy[0], xy[1]);
256                }
257
258                private double[] getGradient(double x, double y) {
259                        double gx = c[1] + 2*c[3]*x + c[5]*y + 2*c[6]*x*y + c[7]*y*y + 2*c[8]*x*y*y;
260                        double gy = c[2] + c[5]*x + 2*c[4]*y + 2*c[7]*x*y + c[6]*x*x + 2*c[8]*x*x*y;
261                        return new double[] {gx, gy};
262                }
263                
264                private double[][] getInverseHessian(double[] xy) {
265                        final double x = xy[0];
266                        final double y = xy[1];
267                        double R = 2*(c[4] + x*(c[7] + c[8]*x));
268                        double S = 2*(c[3] + y*(c[6] + c[8]*y));
269                        double T = c[5] + 2*c[6]*x + 2*c[7]*y + 4*c[8]*x*y;
270                        double a = 1.0 / (R*S - T*T);   // TODO: check denominator for zero!
271                        double[][] Hi = {
272                                        { a*R, -a*T}, 
273                                        {-a*T,  a*S}};
274                        return Hi;
275                }
276        }
277}
